comments:
CDT 2.0.0.200404150300
Eclipse M8

Test case:
1. Create two projects, call them ProjA, and ProjB.
2. Add some simple compileable code to each project for fun.
3. Make ProjA reference on ProjB.
4. Build ProjA.

RESULT:  Both ProjA and ProjB are successfully built.

5. Rename ProjB to Oopsy.
6. Build ProjA.

RESULT:  The build operation dialog appears and never goes away and no build is
produced.

The problem is that ProjA is still referencing ProjB and not recognizing that
ProjB doesn't exist any more as it has been renamed to Oopsy.  This kind of
error should produce a "referenced project not found" error and not block the
build process indefinitely.

Is this with Managed Make ?

I try it here wit boths builders seems to work ok.
Was it a mix of builders ? was it there any external builders
define on the project ?

Dave, Sean any comments ?

I have tried this test on build 200404230300 (where both ProjA and ProjB are
managed C++ projects) and the problem is still present.

> I have tried this test on build 200404230300 (where both ProjA and ProjB are
> managed C++ projects) and the problem is still present.

I've Tried again .. no go.  I can not recreate the race condition 8-(

Can you run in debug mode and suspend all the threads and
dump me the trace("Copy Stack" action in the debug view).

Sean .. you've seen this before ?

Alian,
I have not seen this before. To be fair, though, I cannot remember testing for 
this explicitly.

>> I've Tried again .. no go.  I can not recreate the race condition 8-(

James, if you are not giving us more info, changing the priority
to P1 will not make it more faster to fix 8)
Do you have a copy stack when it hangs?

In the latest from HEAD, I do not get a hang - though I don't get a build
either.  The best I can do at the moment is the contents of the .log file.  If
this isn't enough - let me know and I will dig a little deeper...

This is pretty clearly managed build, no?

I can fix the problem that leads to the failure during build but there might 
still be build errors as a result of incorrect path information for includes 
searches, linker directives, or external object modules needed by the 
referencing project.
I think that's all we can ask for, thanks Sean!

Fixed by checking and rechecking the results of asking a project for its 
referenced projects.

Hi,

This bug cannot be verified until bug# 65624 is fixed.

Thanks,
Pixy.

Pixy,
The two are unrelated bugs as shown by the stack traces. Can you not verify 
that the builder at least runs correctly (no stack exceptions) after a rename? 
If not, that's fine, I guess I just don't see the connection other than they 
happen as a result of the same user gesture.
So Pixy can get in on the discussion...

I verified this bug with Eclipse 20040628 and CDT 200406301134, and it passes.

Pixy.
